business_name: Tonic Smoke Shop, Vape, CBD, Kratom, Puff Bars (Sacramento)
text:
I live very close to this shop and drive by its location daily; because I noticed the sign on the building from Tonic, I thought to myself, "That's a new sign and I think Tonic is a shisha brand. I'll stop in very soon and check it out!" Stopping in is just what I did!

Upon entering, I noticed many hookahs and hookah accessories lining the wall on the left. Hookahs were set up in the middle of the store on tables and it seems as though you can smoke out of them. I didn't ask the guys working if that was what those particular ones were for because I seriously was more interested in finding a new shisha flavor to try out. I had a nice young man help me and I swear he looks just like the comedian Gabriel Iglesias! Anyways, he helped me and I smelled some recommended flavors. I ended up taking home 100g of Purple Mermaid to try out - if I really like it, next time I'll buy a 200g can. He was also nice enough to show me the Tonic brand hookahs that they have. I truly needed to buy a new hookah to replace my current one that has a rusted stem so I ended up buying a Tribes hookah for $35!!! That's right my friends, $35 for a nice sized hookah! The great thing is, Tonic hookahs come with a year warranty in case something happens to your hookah! Score! There are many more hookah accessories in a smaller room in the back of the store and they carry many brands of natural charcoals like Coco Nara and Coco Mazaya. I love this place so much as a hookah smoker and I've visited only once!

Not only am I a fan, but ummm Twisted.....who??!! Sorry Twisted, but I think I found my new hookah shop to go to regularly and if they start carrying Tangiers shisha, it's over for you guys!!
prediction_reason: The review describes a genuine visit and shopping experience at the hookah/vape shop. The reviewer provides detailed information about their visit, the products they purchased (Purple Mermaid shisha and a Tribes hookah), interactions with staff, and specific observations about the store layout and inventory. The content is highly relevant to the business categories (hookah store, vaporizer store, tobacco shop) and demonstrates authentic customer experience.
name: Tonic Smoke Shop, Vape, CBD, Kratom, Puff Bars (Sacramento)

text:
I've gone here so many times with my family.

This year however was rediculious. Not that anyone cares but I live about 30 mins from here. We got the kids pumped, ready and in the car.
As we pull into the parking lot theres 1 sign saying we need to get our tickets online.

The place was NOT packed or full so obviously I go online to get our tickets. I couldnt for the life of me find where to buy these tickets. So we walked up to the entrance where maybe 20 people were standing and asked if I was even on the right sight.
Well apparently they were sold out. With about 100 people on the property.. (This whole place is outside incase anyone hasnt seen it and its a pretty big lot of land.)

If you went successfully. How did you know, beforehand, that you had to buy tickets? And how did you get them?

And there was zero indication on their websight that the tickets were sold out.

Needless to say, for me, I'm taking my family elsewhere this year.

text: My wife and I went to The Whiskey Barrel and had a great server named Julie at 3 p.m. on 24 September 2018. We were greeted quickly with a sincere smile and concurrent drink fillups in making sure we were taken care of. We have posted many pictures showing the great ambiance and great food. We ordered the full rack of Ribs with their homemade BBQ sauce, salad with all the fixings with their homemade Ranch salad dressing, and we substituted the steak fries and Cole slaw for loaded mashed potatoes and vegetable mix. You know how when you go to a restaurant and when you get a salad and they might as well of given you just a head of lettuce? Not here! You get a fresh salad mix with spinach, tomatoes, cheese, onions, cucumber and black oli es. The ribs were juicy with their homemade BBQ sauce, and their loaded mashed potatoes were real!, topped with green onions and cheese. This was the best 25.00 we have ever spent. Julie was also one of the best servers we have come across and she was very knowledgeable about past and current entertainment venues right there at the whiskey barrel. Do not let the empty tables in my pictures fool you. The place is packed in the evening with drink specials definitely to keep you coming back again and again. Family friendly with kids meals also available until 9 p.m. Please see pics. Voted best in the Desert, thanks Julie, you will see us again!

text:
The physical size of this store is really overkill for the services and products available here. I only became a Sprint customer because I had to rescue the one phone number I've kept longer than any other I've ever had in my entire adulthood so far from FreedomPop. Sprint cellular data is the worst in most of the public places I wish I could have enjoyed it (around Tustin & Irvine which are known to be Sprint's dead-zone).

I was very pleased to find out that I wasn't on a contract anymore despite less than 24 months having elapsed between the day I ported the above mentioned number into Sprint and the day I ported out. I was also very pleased to discover that Sprint did not assume I wanted to continue service with a new number after the abovementioned number ported out of Sprint. Sprint ONLY offers unlimited voice & SMS plans, which far exceed my needs and budget.
